messages.message: another question: how much do we care about the “import modules not functions/classes” part of the google style guide (https://github.com/google/styleguide/blob/gh-pages/pyguide.md#22-imports)? it’s pretty inconsistent across our code base, so i’m not sure strongly to call it out on PRs.
personally — i’d like we stick with it because I don’t like >50 segments of imports, but it’s a pretty weak preference.
:point_up::skin-tone-4: I have the same preference to reduce the number of imports
Personally it is easier to navigate to the file where the functions are if we use modules (otherwise one needs to look at the import to figure out the base module)
I also would prefer to stick to it, for whatever that is worth. :slightly_smiling_face:

I'm ok with it. Wasn't aware of that preference or notion, but started doing it since Shaunak mentioned it's in the Google style guide. Historically I never wrote code that way, but I'm ok with this style preference
